thoughts.text: I think I should use the `generate_image` command to generate an image of a visualization using one of the Python libraries for data science.
thoughts.reasoning: Using the `generate_image` command to generate an image of a visualization using one of the Python libraries for data science will allow me to see how the library can be used to create visualizations. This will help me understand how the library can be used in practice and will also give me an idea of what kind of visualizations I can create using the library.
thoughts.plan:
- Use the `google` command to find a tutorial on creating visualizations using one of the Python libraries for data science
- Use the `generate_image` command to create an image of a visualization using the library
- Examine the image to gain a better understanding of how the library can be used to create visualizations
thoughts.criticism: I need to make sure that I am not relying too heavily on the tutorial and that I am still using my own judgement to determine how the library can be used to create visualizations that are relevant to my needs.
thoughts.speak: I think I should use the `generate_image` command to generate an image of a visualization using one of the Python libraries for data science.

args.prompt: Create a visualization using Matplotlib to display the relationship between two variables in a dataset.
